org.ggp.base.util.propnet.factory.flattener

Class PropNetAnnotatedFlattener

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.ggp.base.util.propnet.factory.flattener.PropNetAnnotatedFlattener

  • public final class PropNetAnnotatedFlattener
extends java.lang.Object
    PropNetAnnotatedFlattener is an implementation of a GDL flattener that needs the rules to contain ( base ?x ) propositions that explicitly specify domains for all of the base propositions.

    This flattener should work on all sizes of games, but requires these explicit annotations to be present in the game description; it cannot infer them.

    A separate PropNetAnnotater class is able to generate these annotations. Sadly, it can only annotate relatively simple games. If there are no base propositions in a game description, PropNetAnnotatedFlattener will call the annotater in an attempt to generate annotations.

    To use this class: 

          PropNetAnnotatedFlattener AF = new PropNetAnnotatedFlattener(description); 
      List<GdlRule> flatDescription = AF.flatten();                              
      return converter.convert(flatDescription);

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      java.util.List<GdlRule> flatten()
      Flattens a game description using the following process: Records the rules in the description, and indexes them by head name. Creates an archive of rule instantiations, initialized with true rules. Creates every instantiation of each rule in the description and records the result.
      boolean noAnnotations()

    • Constructor Detail

      • PropNetAnnotatedFlattener

        public PropNetAnnotatedFlattener(java.util.List<Gdl> description)

    • Method Detail

      • flatten

        public java.util.List<GdlRule> flatten()
        Flattens a game description using the following process:
        1. Records the rules in the description, and indexes them by head name.
        2. Creates an archive of rule instantiations, initialized with true rules.
        3. Creates every instantiation of each rule in the description and records the result.
        Returns:
        An equivalent description to the one passed into the constructor, without variables.

      • noAnnotations

        public boolean noAnnotations()
